result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:07 AM Defendant Joseph G Califf not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joseph G Califf.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph G Califf in court in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Joseph G Califf. B. Bahr - Clerk 
DE - will not waive personal appearance. Asks for bond to be heard.
Atty Rivard - client will need to be brought up then.
Court - excuses courtroom so DE can speak to Atty Rivard.

2:14 PM back on the record. All parties present.
Atty Rivard - will waive personal appearance for preliminary hearing.
State - calls Deputy Greg Moen. Witness is sworn in and testifies. Witness identifies the defendant.
Atty Rivard - cross examines witness. Asks court for order preserving all recorded statements by officers made.
Court - grants order preserving all recorded statements by officers made.
2:25 PM Witness is excused
State - argues for probable case and bind over
Atty Rivard - no argument
Court - finds probable cause and binds defendant over
Atty Rivard - asks to be heard on bond modification. Has not filed request though.
Court - will hear request today
Atty Rivard - asks for $50 bond previously posted be the current bond.
State - speaks of defendant's criminal history and failure to appear on EC and St. Croix Co cases. Objects to request to modify bond.
DE - makes a statement to the Court.
Court - makes record of bond ordered in this case. Denies request to modify bond.
Arraignment scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Atty Lundeen - deft has missed Court due to lack of transportation, asks for lower cash bond
